title: Odo1972
author: Odo1972
content: After reading through some articles online I realized that despite the negative effects of war, there are still positive outcomes that can be achieved through war.This brought my attention to the Russian Ukraine war that lasted about 1 year now.Some positive effects that result from war include "the correction of injustices, the defeat of a problematic government, advancement in technology and medicine, and a reduction of unemployment".1. My question now is, has Ukraine achieved any of these positive outcomes in the course of the war?2. As President, would you engage in a war to achieve any of these positive outcomes?

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: If my research is correct (and I think this is an unpopular opinion/conclusion) the main reason that Russia began the war was due to Ukraine's talks to join NATO. Ukraine pursued, Russia followed on its word. Would I start war in this case? No. Putting myself in the presidents' shoes, I am already allied with the great sleeping lion that is China, I am already one of the most powerful countries alongside the US and China, why not instead increase defenses instead of starting war in case Ukraine joining NATO is malicious? In saying that, everyone thinks they can decide better than the current leaders (even me sometimes)...we don't know all of the factors behind their decisions though. It is unfortunate that the world is in a state where these leaders conclude that war is the only way to go.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Odo1972 on February 13, 2023, 03:35:23 PMAfter reading through some articles online I realized that despite the negative effects of war, there are still positive outcomes that can be achieved through war.This brought my attention to the Russian Ukraine war that lasted about 1 year now.Some positive effects that result from war include "the correction of injustices, the defeat of a problematic government, advancement in technology and medicine, and a reduction of unemployment".1. My question now is, has Ukraine achieved any of these positive outcomes in the course of the war?2. As President, would you engage in a war to achieve any of these positive outcomes?We have to agree that fighting wars have no benefit because any event that leads to the loss of lives and property is not acceptable. The death of young children and others supersedes all the benefits or gains of this senseless war.This war has thought both parties a big lesson. Russia thought this war will last for less than two weeks but they have learned their lessons. Russia is now well aware that Ukraine is not militarily weak. They are now aware that with little support from Ukraine's allies, they can withstand the military might of Russia. NATO and Europe are also aware that Russia is a military and economic powerhouse. Even with NATO's support, Russia has proved to be militarily strong and taking more territories in Ukraine. European nations and the US also believed that sanctions will cripple Russia's economy but they have discovered that the Russian economy is to a large extent sanction-proof.Ukraine has gained transfer of scientific and military technology from the US and NATO because the Ukrainian military has been gaining technical and operational knowledge through training. The emergencysector like the fire service and the medical sector has been exposed to different situations. And they have also gained some skills from some international organizations like Red Cross. Some doctors and medical personnel have also received advanced training from other countries.If I were the president I would never engage in this war to gain these advantages. The lives of my citizens are worth more than these benefits. And these benefits or gains can be achieved without fighting. I don't also see how the war has reduced unemployment, it even increased it.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: In a conflict, there is no gain. Any nation that fights in war has a great deal to lose.The lives of each and every one of my citizens would count if I were the president of Ukraine, thus I would try my hardest to avoid starting a war with Russia. If there should be a victory in a battle, I tend not to look at it cos I stand at the verge of losing life and human resourcesFor Ukrainians to fully heal from the pain and suffering the war against Russia has brought, it will take many years.

This war had create severe unemployment, scatter the school system and is lead a lots of people to people if this war continues with the goal of ending the war. Russia is a big country that had the resources to fight against Ukraine with full force but the help of other NATO countries had repelled the ambition of the Russian federation to take over Ukraine. This war had to stop or else people will keep dying.

comments.author: Odo1972
comments.body: Majority of the replies here is an indication that war is bad and not an option. In a war, both the Victor and the Vanquish have something to lose, especially the lives of the innocent civilians. This war has lingered, I hope the two countries would find reasons to end it already to save the continuous loss of lives and properties.

comments.body: Engaging in a war that would put the lives of my citizens, my loved ones and myself in danger, as a president I can't think of going to war or start something like that instead I'll seek for advice or probably protection, first to stop the chaos that's about to begin before doing the needful. Sometimes people just look for a way to pass an ugly message that they're superior over the other by activating war, and when they are declared winner they start bragging as if that's the right thing to do.As a president all you do is make sure your subject are happy and in a good condition, protection too. It doesn't have to be this way, in the case of Russia and Ukraine they just need to find a way to settle the whole issue between them for the sake of their citizens.

As President, would you engage in a war to achieve any of these positive outcomes?Perhaps I'm a bit cynical, but I think the positives of the war from the Ukrainian perspective include receiving trillions in dollars of aid from the United States, advanced weaponry, their enemies weakened, and better deals moving forward to help their country prosper.Â  They of course now become the center of the proxy war between NATO and Russia, but I assume their leaders are being compensated under the table with riches that the average man can only dream of.It would be hard to say what I would do if I were the President of Ukraine.Â  With the information I have, of course I wouldn't have gone to war.Â  I don't have any information about how much their leader is getting promised and how much money is flowing under the table to him, so it's tough to answer the question realistically.

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: Quote from: af_newbie on February 28, 2023, 03:11:21 PMQuote from: Lordhermes on February 28, 2023, 11:40:59 AMPresident Zelensky made a big mistake by engaging in war with Putin, knowning too well that he can't stand Putin, I think this dispute can only be resolved through peace talk. I'm appealing to Putin and Zelensky to end the dispute for humanity sake.The Russian side has presented unacceptable terms.Peace talks can only be held after the Russian army withdraws from Ukraine or is destroyed in Ukraine.This war will not end until Putin's army is pushed back out of Ukraine.The peace talks will be held long after Putin is killed or commits suicide.PS. If I were Putin, I would gradually withdraw my army and prepare the public for a "victory". Everyone in Russia will be more than happyto have him end this war. He might even sell it that he is a national hero, long-term strategist, genius chess player, etc. Whatever.If Putin and Russia withdrew, gave the land back to Ukraine, and ended the war,In a few short years (but maybe only months) Ukraine and Nato would be attacking Russia to break her up for US enterprises to take over.Now, that might not be a bad idea, but it would be a foolish idea for Russia. Until Zelensky withdraws his military, Russia needs to fight to remain a viable, prosperous country.If Zelensky turned his military off, and if the US withdrew from Ukraine, Russia would back off, as well... though not right away. The treaty of Minsk was supposed to do this kind of thing by not letting the war happen in the first place. But the US and Ukraine broke the treaty. Merkel even said that the treaty was meant only to hold Russia back so that Ukraine could build up its war armament for this war, which they would have mounted against Russia for nothing except conquest.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Knowing myself, I would have started a military resistance to stop the advance of the invader, much like the president of Ukraine is doing right now, however I would also try to negotiate and see if there is some diplomatic way out from the conflict. I do not like war, and since I have used some of my time investigating about its cruelty, I would try to save as many lives as possible.
